poem:
Starwatch  

In the night, Capricornus,  
sea goat of ancient eyes,  
whispers myths spun by  
Babylonian fires—  
where clay tablets  
breathe stories,  
and Ptolemy's hand  
traces faint echoes in  
the sky. Among chimera dreams,  
we search the heavens for shadows  
of our own creation,  
unknowingly weaving the past  
into quiet stars.
